info.name: Gracile nucleus
info.description: The gracile nucleus contains the second-order neurons that receive tactile, vibratory and proprioceptive input from the lower body and lower extremity via the gracile fasciculus of the spinal cord. The axons of these gracile neurons decussate in the medulla to form the medial lemniscus which will travel to and synapse in the ventral posterior lateral nucleus of the thalamus.
